comment.text: Essential for the control of the cell cycle at the G1/S (start) and the G2/M (mitosis) transitions.

Interacts with the CDK1 and CDK2 protein kinases to form a serine/threonine kinase holoenzyme complex. The cyclin subunit imparts substrate specificity to the complex. When associated with CDK2 (but not with CDK1), interacts with SCAPER.
Accumulates steadily during G2 and is abruptly destroyed at mitosis.

Polyubiquitinated via 'Lys-11'-linked ubiquitin by the anaphase-promoting complex (APC/C), leading to its degradation by the proteasome. Deubiquitinated and stabilized by USP37 enables entry into S phase (By similarity).
Belongs to the cyclin family. Cyclin AB subfamily.

property.value: Cyclin A/B1 associated events during G2/M transition
